about.paragraph1: I'm Santiago Narv√°ez, a chess instructor specialized in teaching beginners and intermediates. My passion is making chess accessible and exciting for everyone, regardless of your starting level. With years of experience teaching online, I've developed a method that combines traditional instruction with AI technology to create a truly personalized learning experience.
about.paragraph2: My strength lies in my ability to explain complex concepts in a simple and clear way. I'm not a tournament grandmaster, but that allows me to connect better with students who are beginning their chess journey. I understand your challenges because I've faced them too. I currently teach online classes from Margarita Island, Venezuela, helping students from around the world improve their game.
about.philosophyTitle: Teaching Method: Personalized, Practical and Effective
about.philosophyText: My method combines theory with constant practice, specifically adapted to your level and goals. I use AI to create personalized study material, analyze your games in depth, and design exercises that strengthen your weak areas. Each class is individual (one-on-one), which allows me to adjust the pace and content to your specific needs.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Here you'll find answers to the most common inquiries. If your doubt isn't resolved, feel free to contact me directly.

questions.q: What do I need to start the chess classes?
questions.a: Mainly, a stable internet connection and a free account on Chess.com and/or Lichess.org, as we agree for our sessions. A microphone is recommended for smooth communication, and of course, enthusiasm to explore the world of chess!

Payments are securely managed through platforms like PayPal, Payoneer, or Binance. Once we define the course or class package that best suits you, I will provide the details to make the transaction. If you need a payment plan, we can discuss it.

questions.q: Are these courses suitable if I've never played chess before?
questions.a: Definitely! The 'Beginner Course: Liftoff' is specially designed for those approaching chess for the first time. I will accompany you from the basic movements of the pieces to your first strategies, all in a patient and motivating learning environment.

questions.q: How does your teaching method differ from other online courses?
questions.a: My distinctive approach lies in deep personalization, enhanced with AI tools. This allows me to adapt each lesson, study material, and exercise to your individual pace, learning style, and specific areas of interest.

questions.q: How long are the classes and what is the recommended frequency?
questions.a: Standard individual classes are 60 minutes long. Regarding frequency, I suggest one or two classes per week for consistent progress and good assimilation of concepts, although we can always adjust it to your availability and goals.

questions.q: Is study material or exercises provided to practice between classes?
questions.a: Yes, of course. As part of the method, you will receive access to bilingual digital study material, selected exercises, and game analysis (with AI support) so you can consolidate your learning and practice at your own pace.

questions.q: What AI tools or platforms are used and how do they benefit me?
questions.a: I use a combination of recognized chess analysis software and AI tools for content creation. These technologies help me identify patterns in your game, generate exercises tailored to your needs, and create more efficient and personalized study materials.
